title: Start Service Process (v4) - Overview
body: The Start Service process has been streamlined in 2025. Standard residential customers can now be activated same-day with just ID verification. No deposits required for customers with credit score >650. Corporate accounts follow expedited pathway. This replaces the previous SSN+deposit requirement from v1-v3.

title: Start Service Process (v4) - Eligibility
body: Eligibility requirements: 1) Valid government ID, 2) Credit check (>650 score preferred), 3) Property ownership or lease verification. Special cases: Corporate accounts require business license. Students can use parent/guardian co-signature. Military personnel get expedited processing.

title: Start Service Runbook (v1) - Eligibility
body: Customers must provide SSN or deposit. Exception: corporate accounts with business license are exempt from deposit. Deposit amounts: $150 standard, $300 high-risk. Note: The corporate exemption rule from this version still applies even in newer processes - business accounts never require deposits regardless of credit score.

title: Start Service Runbook (v1) - Deposit Details
body: Deposit calculation methodology: Base amount $150. Add $50 for each previous disconnection. Add $100 for credit score <500. Maximum deposit cap is $500. These detailed calculations are still used by billing systems even though newer docs only mention simplified requirements.

title: Stop Service Workflow (v3)
body: Service termination process: 1) Customer request via phone/web, 2) Final meter reading, 3) Final bill calculation, 4) Equipment return if applicable, 5) Deposit refund processing. Process typically takes 5-10 business days.

title: Stop Service Workflow (v3) - Final Billing
body: Final bill includes: prorated usage charges, outstanding balance, late fees, equipment charges if not returned, minus security deposit refund. Bill must be paid within 30 days to avoid collection action. Deposit refunds issued via check within 10 business days.

title: Payment Plan Setup (v2)
body: Payment plans available for customers with past-due balances >$200. Plans can be 3, 6, or 12 months. Requires down payment of 20% of total balance. Setup fee $25. Automatic payments required.

title: Payment Plan Setup (v2) - Eligibility
body: Eligibility criteria: 1) Balance >$200, 2) No active payment plan, 3) No more than 2 payment plan defaults in past 24 months, 4) Account not in bankruptcy. Special consideration for hardship cases with supervisor approval.

title: Payment Plan Setup (v1) - Hardship Programs
body: Hardship program details: Medical emergency payment plans can waive setup fees and reduce down payment to 10%. Required documentation: doctor's note, hospital bills, income verification. This hardship provision was detailed in v1 but simplified language in v2 doesn't mention the specific medical emergency benefits.

title: Meter Reading Correction Process (v2)
body: When meter reading appears incorrect: 1) Verify reading against previous months, 2) Check for estimated vs actual readings, 3) Dispatch field technician if variance >50%, 4) Adjust bill if meter error confirmed, 5) Credit customer account for overcharges plus 10% goodwill credit.

title: Meter Reading Variance Thresholds (v2)
body: Electric meter reading variance thresholds for correction workflow: Residential meter readings with <25% variance require no action, 25-50% variance triggers automatic reread scheduling, >50% variance requires field technician dispatch. Commercial meter thresholds are 15% and 35% respectively due to higher usage volatility patterns.

title: Time-of-Use Rate Switch (v3)
body: Customers can switch between standard and time-of-use rates once per year. TOU rates offer lower prices during off-peak hours (9pm-7am) but higher prices during peak (3pm-7pm). Switch takes effect on next billing cycle. Requires smart meter installation.

title: Time-of-Use Rate Switch (v3) - Eligibility
body: TOU eligibility: 1) Residential customers only, 2) Smart meter installed, 3) No rate change in past 12 months, 4) Account in good standing. Commercial customers have separate TOU programs managed by Key Accounts team.

title: Customer Summary API (v2)
body: GET /api/v2/customer/{id}/summary - Returns customer account summary including balance, service status, payment history. Required headers: Authorization, X-API-Version. Rate limit: 1000 req/min per API key. Response includes: account_number, service_address, current_balance, last_payment, service_status.

title: Enhanced Transaction API (v1)
body: POST /api/v1/transactions/search - Search transaction history with enhanced filtering. Supports date ranges, amount filters, transaction types. Parameters: customer_id (required), start_date, end_date, min_amount, max_amount, transaction_type. Returns paginated results with transaction details.

title: Account Utility API (v3)
body: GET /api/v3/account/{account_number}/utility - Retrieve account utility information including service type, rate schedule, meter details. Headers: Authorization required. Returns: service_type, rate_code, meter_number, installation_date, last_read_date, next_read_date.

title: Customer Interaction API (v2)
body: POST /api/v2/interactions - Create customer interaction record. Required fields: customer_id, interaction_type, channel, summary. Optional: resolution, follow_up_required. Interaction types: call, email, chat, field_visit. Channel values: phone, web, mobile, in_person.

title: Digital Events API (v1)
body: GET /api/v1/events/digital - Retrieve digital engagement events for analytics. Query parameters: customer_id, event_type, start_date, end_date. Event types: login, bill_view, payment, auto_pay_setup, paperless_signup. Response includes timestamps, event details, user agent info.

title: Product Catalog API (v1)
body: GET /api/v1/catalog/products - Retrieve utility product catalog. Optional filters: product_type, availability_zone. Returns: product_id, name, description, base_rate, availability. Product types: residential_electric, commercial_electric, natural_gas, renewable_energy.

title: Global Customer Platform Architecture (v2)
body: Global Customer Platform technical architecture documentation. Platform microservices include Customer Identity Service, Account Federation Service, and Data Synchronization Engine. Architecture uses event-driven design with Kafka messaging and Redis caching. Platform deployment topology spans multiple data centers with active-active configuration.

title: Service Reconnection Process (v2)
body: Reconnection after disconnection: 1) Pay past-due balance plus reconnection fee, 2) Security deposit may be required if account was disconnected >3 times in 12 months, 3) Schedule reconnection appointment, 4) Field technician restores service, 5) Confirm service restoration. Reconnection fee: $75 standard, $125 after-hours.

title: Service Reconnection (v1) - Fee Structure
body: Detailed reconnection fee structure: Base fee $75. After-hours (6pm-8am, weekends) adds $50 surcharge. Emergency reconnection (same day) adds $100 expedite fee. Multiple disconnection penalty: +$25 for each disconnection in past 6 months. These detailed fee rules are still applied by billing systems.

title: Bill Dispute Process (v3)
body: Customer bill disputes: 1) Initial review by care team, 2) Field investigation if needed, 3) Billing adjustment if error found, 4) Customer notification of resolution. Disputes must be filed within 60 days of bill date. Resolution target: 10 business days.

title: Bill Dispute Process (v2) - Investigation Types
body: Investigation types: Meter accuracy check, usage comparison analysis, rate verification, billing calculation review. Meter accuracy investigations require field technician dispatch and can take up to 21 days. If meter found faulty, customer receives full refund plus interest.

title: Outage Reporting Process (v1)
body: Outage reporting channels: 1) Customer calls 1-800-OUTAGE, 2) Web portal outage map, 3) Mobile app report, 4) Social media monitoring. All reports logged in Outage Management System with GPS coordinates and customer impact assessment.

title: Outage Restoration Process (v1)
body: Restoration priorities: 1) Critical infrastructure (hospitals, emergency services), 2) Large commercial customers, 3) Residential areas by customer count. Estimated restoration times communicated via website, app, and automated calls. Updates provided every 2 hours during active restoration.

title: Residential Tariff Schedule (v4)
body: Standard residential rates: Energy charge $0.12/kWh, Basic service charge $15/month, Demand charge applies only to usage >2000 kWh/month at $8/kW. Time-of-use option available with peak $0.18/kWh (3-7pm), off-peak $0.08/kWh (9pm-7am), mid-peak $0.12/kWh (7am-3pm, 7-9pm).

title: Commercial Tariff Schedule (v3)
body: Commercial rate structure: Demand charge $12/kW, Energy charge varies by usage tier: 0-5000 kWh $0.11/kWh, 5001-20000 kWh $0.10/kWh, >20000 kWh $0.09/kWh. Power factor penalty applies if <0.90. Monthly facilities charge $50.

title: Field Safety Procedures (v2)
body: Mandatory safety procedures for field operations: 1) Lock-out/Tag-out verification, 2) Personal protective equipment inspection, 3) Gas detection for underground work, 4) Two-person rule for high-voltage work, 5) Weather conditions assessment. Safety violations result in immediate work stoppage.

title: Field Safety Procedures (v1) - Equipment Standards
body: Required safety equipment specifications: Hard hats must be Class E rated for electrical work, Safety glasses ANSI Z87.1 compliant, Steel-toe boots with electrical hazard rating, Arc-rated clothing for work >40V. Equipment inspection required monthly, replacement every 6 months for hard hats. These specific standards remain current.

title: Employee Onboarding Program (v2)
body: New employee onboarding: Week 1 - HR orientation, system access setup, safety training. Week 2 - Department-specific training, job shadowing. Week 3 - Hands-on practice with mentor. Week 4 - Assessment and certification. 90-day follow-up review scheduled.

title: Certification Requirements (v1)
body: Required certifications by role: Field Technicians - OSHA 10, Electrical Safety, CPR/First Aid. Customer Care - De-escalation training, HIPAA, Payment processing. Supervisors - Leadership training, Performance management, Regulatory compliance. Annual recertification required for safety-related certifications.
